comment.body: These are nice, but a really detailed logo might look bad in the Zeronet button in the top right corner. Maybe it should keep the rounded logo?

> [nofish](#comment_26_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Here is a concept how would it look like in the topright corner (and also favicon and chrome button): https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10350359/10117719/4162b6b8-6460-11e5-8e48-9466bf6dac73.png

Hmmm... Looks nice-ish, but I think that the two gaps might not show up well on that scale, in my opinion. Also, would the triple line icon be changed at all?
Will this be related to a system for notifying users when their comments are replied to? Or would that be something else?

Nice so far. I've noticed a few things though :
1: If too many sites are saved, the list will extend much farther down than the recent blog content--for example, my ~100 saved sites go way past the 10 or so posts on this blog (I can post an image if you want to see what this looks like). I suggest using the same scrollbar that the click-and-drag menu uses (the one with the globe and site stats), so that the site list only extends to the bottom of the blog posts.
2: Will the 'follow' feature be easy to add to existing blogs?
3: Will it be possible to sort sites by name, number of seeds, time since last update, etc?
4: Will favoriting/ tagging sites be implemented? 
5: Will the old card view play any part in the new homepage?

Sorry for the barrage of questions. I'm pretty excited about how the new homepage works so far.
I would suggest using the [pump.io/](http://pump.io/) framework for this, but it might be too server-centric to be of use here--Not sure.

> [berliner](#comment_1_163rm8X1WReQzp1uAZjbrCHkF7En1VTXbU): Donald Drumpf may outlaw zeronet !

Considering how I can basically email my friends the startup bundle, that's gonna be pretty hard. I'd say 'come at us bro', but I don't want to give him any ideas.

> [chr51570](#comment_1_1B1KzuAuS2KYZ57Zg6VGoYrFpBKDpqRjdg): ProtonMail over ZeroNetwork = unhackable, secure, server-less email system?

The web client is [open source](https://github.com/ProtonMail). Not sure how easy it is to self-host it though.

Occasionally when using the new search box, I get an error like this:
````
Internal error: OperationalError: no such table: main.secret

UiWebsocket.py line 98 > UiWebsocket.py line 178 > NewsfeedPlugin.py line 61 > 
SiteStorage.py line 68 > SiteStorage.py line 45 > SiteStorage.py line 89 > 
Db.py line 164 > DbCursor.py line 104 > DbCursor.py line 94 > DbCursor.py line 53
````
(second part is all on a single line)
It seems to happen when I enter text very slowly.

> [nofish](#comment_79_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): I was unable to reproduce, but I think its fixed by https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commit/6f8c24e11da7385b0d95fa625cc74161f2cd7486

It seems to be gone now.
